test.name: chi_square_with_cramers_v
test.description: Performs a chi-square test of independence on the per-sample × cell-type proportion table to detect significant heterogeneity across replicates within the TBI_24hr condition, and computes Cramér's V as an effect size.

scoring.stat_definition: The chi-square test evaluates whether cell type proportions vary significantly between TBI_24hr samples; Cramér's V quantifies the strength of that variation.
scoring.description: Pass if heterogeneity in cell type proportions across TBI_24hr replicates is non-significant after Benjamini–Hochberg correction (q ≥ 0.05) and the effect size is small (Cramér's V ≤ 0.15).
